channel.title: Improvisation with the Factor Oracle :: Hugo Relearn Theme

item.title: General Description
item.description: Input is passed to patchers two ways: synchronously and asynchronously, depending on the type of input data.

item.title: Description of the Factor Oracle
item.description: The oracle factor patch is here: patchers/data_structures/factor_oracle/factor_oracle.maxpat To use different comparison functions, you need to write a Max patch that performs the label comparison.

item.title: Description of the Factor Oracle
item.description: The biggest step was to complete the factor oracle object, which is generalized for different data types, and the factor_oracle_player object for improvising with it.

item.title: The Factor Oracle Player
item.description: patchers/factor_oracle_player/factor_oracle_player.maxpat The “factor oracle player” which takes labels one by one, which can be of any form (but in the current program, it’s a dictionary with two entries: the chord root and the chord label), and uses a factor oracle to produce a beat that matches the label.

item.title: The Factor Oracle Player
item.description: The “factor oracle player” which takes labels one by one, which can be of any form (but in the current program, it’s a dictionary with two entries: the chord root and the chord label), and uses a factor oracle to produce a beat that matches the label.
